newsitem.title: USA: Korean finalises deal for new JFK cargo facility.
newsitem.headline: Korean finalises deal for new JFK cargo facility.

text.p: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey said it formally finalised a lease agreement with Korean Airlines for a $105 million air cargo hub at JFK.
Korean Air Ltd agreed to demolish hangars 9 and 9A built in 1955, the authority said in a statement.
The airline, as part of the lease, will construct and operate a new 225,000 sq ft facility built on 21 acres of the 42 acre site.
The remaining 22 acres are reserved by the Port Authority for future use, an industry source said.
Korean Airlines currently operates a 99,000 sq ft cargo complex at JFK airport.
